articles.description: Unexpected biosignatures found in a startlingly blue volcanic goo beneath the Pacific Ocean may offer clues to life's origins.
articles.content:
Unexpected biosignatures found in a startlingly blue volcanic goo beneath the Pacific Ocean may offer clues to life's origins.

articles.author: Ethan Siegel
articles.title: How the "meter" came to be exactly one meter long - Big Think
articles.description: Until the late 20th century, there wasn't a truly universal standard. Under our current definition, everyone agrees on what "one meter" is.

articles.title: Nine-ton giant dinosaur with duck-like face discovered in New Mexico - Earth.com
articles.description: The fossils found reveal the existence of Ahshislesaurus wimani, a new, duck-billed hadrosaur from the late Cretaceous period.
articles.content: A new duck-billed dinosaur from northern New Mexico turns out to be a species we did not have on the books. It lived about 75 million years ago in the late Cretaceous, when rivers laced a warm, coast… [+5068 chars]
